summary: Lulu's Law mandates that the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) issue an order allowing wireless emergency alerts (Alert Messages) to be transmitted in the event of a shark attack. The bill, introduced in the Senate, directs the FCC to act within 180 days of the bill's enactment. It cites Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, stating the document is in the public domain and not subject to copyright.
